channel.title: jimgrisham tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from jimgrisham.

item.description: ‚Äúcorruption cannot be centralized‚Äù There‚Äôs never just one termite. https://t.co/5QyEcHKKwc

Did you or a friend see shocking news? Please sleep on it, or at least do some fact-checking, prior to sharing. ‚ÄúThe war shortfall is 0.9% of the global wheat crop! Not 25%!‚Äù https://t.co/hl3IgVZpgS

@jrochest @mvhElmore @kamilkazani It‚Äôs an interesting strategy for purely industrial substations, though. Anti-drone defenses, in the rare places they exist, might ignore drones too small to carry significant explosives, for example, but if consumer-level drones could do something like this‚Ä¶

@br92168132 @GwizoKeith @TrentTelenko You may also be interested in his (@kamilkazani‚Äôs) other recent threads, summarized here: (he also has an article, posted on his 2nd Substack site, called ‚ÄúWhy is Russia so big?‚Äù - highly recommended, even for those deeply familiar with the region‚Äôs history) https://t.co/gNXh7QI33B
@Deer_Hirsch @GwizoKeith @TrentTelenko Clipboards and checklists. Grease pencils. More checklists. So many checklists. (I have it on good authority that Powerpoint is an offensive cyber-weapon.)
@NoleFan3884 @TrentTelenko In fairness, those crates don‚Äôt seem to be of a condition conducive to neat and orderly stacking.
@EntierSpectre @kamilkazani Think about how corrupt road constriction can be in other countries, then apply that to what you know about Russia.
‚ÄúIn the good economy expensive oil years they never learnt how to garden from their babushka and now won't learn quickly‚Äù https://t.co/z8Gex1laeG
@Danniboy808 @TrentTelenko Overtime pay and express shipping for parts delivery?
@igorsushko Professor @Olga_Chyzh has explained the theory behind this in some detail. From the middle of a well-written üßµ by her earlier this month: https://t.co/5rS9YZzwrs

For some in ‚Äòelite‚Äô in Russia this could be about oil and gas routes, or a ‚Äòbuffer‚Äô from the ‚ÄòWest‚Äô, but #Putin himself may actually have less material motivations. (last in aüßµ by @noclador): https://t.co/qgckKRTlh4

‚ÄúTop Gun-style aerial dogfights, rare in modern warfare, are now raging above the country.‚Äù ‚ÄúUkraine now has roughly 55 operational fighter jets, a number that is dwindling from shoot-downs and mechanical failures, as Ukrainian pilots are ‚Äú‚Äòstressing them to max performance.‚Äô‚Äù https://t.co/fMtlx2Ltef

‚ÄúThe only real analysts who come here from Russia are dissidents. The rest are front people, just like in the Soviet Union, and they manufacture Western champions of the Putin regime, chumps and useful idiots.‚Äù https://t.co/lfokUuwkrO

@JohnWet75740342 @igorsushko @BasDanteNero @France24_en @LeopoldineIL You‚Äôre assuming they‚Äôre typed and digitized. (They could be photos or faxed copies of handwritten letters, or something even equally hard to get flagged by automated security software.)
@SimonsRatio @TrentTelenko Not even his military seems to have that kind of access these days, after all.
@NotACriminal2 @Rrrrolf @CJhuber12 @TrentTelenko I mean, they tried to hide it by covering the top with branches‚Ä¶
@BbqBricks @Rrrrolf @CJhuber12 @TrentTelenko Check local barns?
@YWNReporter As kids we were always warned to listen for the sound of a freight train.
